documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: kernel security, bug fix, and enhancement update

note.text:
An update for kernel is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The kernel packages contain the Linux kernel, the core of any Linux operating system.

Security Fix(es):

* off-path attacker may inject data or terminate victim's TCP session (CVE-2020-36516)

* use-after-free vulnerability in function sco_sock_sendmsg() (CVE-2021-3640)

* smb2_ioctl_query_info NULL pointer dereference (CVE-2022-0168)

* NULL pointer dereference in udf_expand_file_adinicbdue() during writeback (CVE-2022-0617)

* swiotlb information leak with DMA_FROM_DEVICE (CVE-2022-0854)

* uninitialized registers on stack in nft_do_chain can cause kernel pointer leakage to UM (CVE-2022-1016)

* race condition in snd_pcm_hw_free leading to use-after-free (CVE-2022-1048)

* use-after-free and memory errors in ext4 when mounting and operating on a corrupted image (CVE-2022-1184)

* concurrency use-after-free between drm_setmaster_ioctl and drm_mode_getresources (CVE-2022-1280)

* kernel info leak issue in pfkey_register (CVE-2022-1353)

* use-after-free in ath9k_htc_probe_device() could cause an escalation of privileges (CVE-2022-1679)

* NULL pointer dereference in x86_emulate_insn may lead to DoS (CVE-2022-1852)

* fanotify misuses fd_install() which could lead to use-after-free (CVE-2022-1998)

* nf_tables cross-table potential use-after-free may lead to local privilege escalation (CVE-2022-2586)

* integer underflow leads to out-of-bounds write in reserve_sfa_size() (CVE-2022-2639)

* slab-out-of-bounds access in packet_recvmsg() (CVE-2022-20368)

* incomplete clean-up of multi-core shared buffers (aka SBDR) (CVE-2022-21123)

* incomplete clean-up of microarchitectural fill buffers (aka SBDS) (CVE-2022-21125)

* incomplete clean-up in specific special register write operations (aka DRPW) (CVE-2022-21166)

* possible to use the debugger to write zero into a location of choice (CVE-2022-21499)

* AMD: RetBleed Arbitrary Speculative Code Execution with Return Instructions (CVE-2022-23816, CVE-2022-29900)

* AMD: Branch Type Confusion (non-retbleed) (CVE-2022-23825)

* Intel: Post-barrier Return Stack Buffer Predictions (CVE-2022-26373)

* double free in ems_usb_start_xmit in drivers/net/can/usb/ems_usb.c (CVE-2022-28390)

* use after free in SUNRPC subsystem (CVE-2022-28893)

* use-after-free due to improper update of reference count in net/sched/cls_u32.c (CVE-2022-29581)

* Intel: RetBleed Arbitrary Speculative Code Execution with Return Instructions (CVE-2022-29901)

* DoS in nfqnl_mangle in net/netfilter/nfnetlink_queue.c (CVE-2022-36946)

* nf_tables disallow binding to already bound chain (CVE-2022-39190)

* nfs_atomic_open() returns uninitialized data instead of ENOTDIR (CVE-2022-24448)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.1 Release Notes linked from the References section.
note.title: Details

note.text: A TCP/IP packet spoofing attack flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s TCP/IP protocol, where a Man-in-the-Middle Attack (MITM) performs an IP fragmentation attack and an IPID collision. This flaw allows a remote user to pretend to be the sender of the TCP/IP packet for an existing TCP/IP session.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2059928: CVE-2020-36516 kernel: off-path attacker may inject data or terminate victim's TCP session

note.text: A flaw use-after-free in function sco_sock_sendmsg() of the Linux kernel HCI subsystem was found in the way user calls ioct UFFDIO_REGISTER or other way triggers race condition of the call sco_conn_del() together with the call sco_sock_sendmsg() with the expected controllable faulting memory page. A privileged local user could use this flaw to crash the system or escalate their privileges on the system.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#1980646: CVE-2021-3640 kernel: use-after-free vulnerability in function sco_sock_sendmsg()

note.text: A denial of service (DOS) issue was found in the Linux kernel’s smb2_ioctl_query_info function in the fs/cifs/smb2ops.c Common Internet File System (CIFS) due to an incorrect return from the memdup_user function. This flaw allows a local, privileged (CAP_SYS_ADMIN) attacker to crash the system.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2037386: CVE-2022-0168 kernel: smb2_ioctl_query_info NULL pointer dereference

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Billy Jheng Bing Jhong (STAR Labs) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A NULL pointer dereference was found in the Linux kernel’s UDF file system functionality in the way the user triggers the udf_file_write_iter function for a malicious UDF image. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2053632: CVE-2022-0617 kernel: NULL pointer dereference in udf_expand_file_adinicbdue() during writeback

note.text: A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s DMA subsystem, in the way a user calls DMA_FROM_DEVICE. This flaw allows a local user to read random memory from the kernel space.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2058395: CVE-2022-0854 kernel: swiotlb information leak with DMA_FROM_DEVICE

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Halil Pasic for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel in net/netfilter/nf_tables_core.c:nft_do_chain, which can cause a use-after-free. This issue needs to handle 'return' with proper preconditions, as it can lead to a kernel information leak problem caused by a local, unprivileged attacker.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2066614: CVE-2022-1016 kernel: uninitialized registers on stack in nft_do_chain can cause kernel pointer leakage to UM

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank David Bouman for reporting this issue.

note.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s sound subsystem in the way a user triggers concurrent calls of PCM hw_params. The hw_free ioctls or similar race condition happens inside ALSA PCM for other ioctls. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2066706: CVE-2022-1048 kernel: race condition in snd_pcm_hw_free leading to use-after-free

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Takashi Iwai for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in KVM. When updating a guest's page table entry, vm_pgoff was improperly used as the offset to get the page's pfn. As vaddr and vm_pgoff are controllable by user-mode processes, this flaw allows unprivileged local users on the host to write outside the userspace region and potentially corrupt the kernel, resulting in a denial of service condition.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2069793: CVE-2022-1158 kernel: KVM: cmpxchg_gpte can write to pfns outside the userspace region

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Gaoning Pan (Zhejiang University), Qiuhao Li (Harbin Institute of Technology), and Yongkang Jia (Zhejiang University) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in fs/ext4/namei.c:dx_insert_block() in the Linux kernel’s filesystem sub-component. This flaw allows a local attacker with a user privilege to cause a denial of service.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2070205: use-after-free and memory errors in ext4 when mounting and operating on a corrupted image

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Wenqing Liu for reporting this issue.

note.text: A NULL pointer dereference issue was found in KVM when releasing a vCPU with dirty ring support enabled. This flaw allows an unprivileged local attacker on the host to issue specific ioctl calls, causing a kernel oops condition that results in a denial of service.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2072698: NULL pointer dereference in kvm_dirty_ring_push in virt/kvm/dirty_ring.c

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Gaoning Pan (Zhejiang University), Qiuhao Li (Harbin Institute of Technology), and Yongkang Jia (Zhejiang University) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A use-after-free vulnerability was found in drm_lease_held in drivers/gpu/drm/drm_lease.c in the Linux kernel due to a race problem. This flaw allows a local user privilege attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) or a kernel information leak.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2071022: CVE-2022-1280 kernel: concurrency use-after-free between drm_setmaster_ioctl and drm_mode_getresources

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Yuan Ming (Tsinghua University) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A vulnerability was found in the pfkey_register function in net/key/af_key.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local, unprivileged user to gain access to kernel memory, leading to a system crash or a leak of internal kernel information.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2066819: CVE-2022-1353 kernel: kernel info leak issue in pfkey_register

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank elijahbai (Tencent Security Yunding Lab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s Atheros wireless adapter driver in the way a user forces the ath9k_htc_wait_for_target function to fail with some input messages. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2084125: CVE-2022-1679 kernel: use-after-free in ath9k_htc_probe_device() could cause an escalation of privileges

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank elijahbai (Tencent Security Yunding Lab) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s KVM module, which can lead to a denial of service in the x86_emulate_insn in arch/x86/kvm/emulate.c. This flaw occurs while executing an illegal instruction in guest in the Intel CPU.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2089815: CVE-2022-1852 kernel: NULL pointer dereference in x86_emulate_insn may lead to DoS

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Gaoning Pan ((Zhejiang University)), Qiuhao Li ((Harbin Institute of Technology)), and Yongkang Jia ((Zhejiang University)) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s File System notify functionality in the way a user triggers the copy_info_records_to_user() function call to fail in copy_event_to_user(). This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2052312: CVE-2022-1998 kernel: fanotify misuses fd_install() which could lead to use-after-free

note.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s KVM when attempting to set a SynIC IRQ. This issue makes it possible for a misbehaving VMM to write to SYNIC/STIMER MSRs, causing a NULL pointer dereference. This flaw allows an unprivileged local attacker on the host to issue specific ioctl calls, causing a kernel oops condition that results in a denial of service.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2069736: CVE-2022-2153 kernel: KVM: NULL pointer dereference in kvm_irq_delivery_to_apic_fast()

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Gaoning Pan (Zhejiang University) and Yongkang Jia (Zhejiang University) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in nf_tables cross-table in the net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c function in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local, privileged attacker to cause a use-after-free problem at the time of table deletion, possibly leading to local privilege escalation.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2114878: CVE-2022-2586 kernel: nf_tables cross-table potential use-after-free may lead to local privilege escalation

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Team Orca (Sea Security) for reporting this issue.

note.text: An integer coercion error was found in the openvswitch kernel module. Given a sufficiently large number of actions, while copying and reserving memory for a new action of a new flow, the reserve_sfa_size() function does not return -EMSGSIZE as expected, potentially leading to an out-of-bounds write access. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2084479: CVE-2022-2639 kernel: openvswitch: integer underflow leads to out-of-bounds write in reserve_sfa_size()

note.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s video4linux driver in how a user triggers the em28xx_usb_probe() for the Empia 28xx-based TV cards. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Dongliang Mu for reporting this issue.

note.text: An out-of-bounds access issue was found in the Linux kernel networking subsystem in the way raw packet sockets (AF_PACKET) used PACKET_COPY_THRESH and mmap operations. A local attacker with CAP_NET_RAW capability could use this flaw to trigger a buffer overflow resulting in a system crash or privilege escalation.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2123695: CVE-2022-20368 kernel: net/packet: slab-out-of-bounds access in packet_recvmsg()

note.text: In verity_target of dm-verity-target.c, there is a possible way to modify read-only files due to a missing permission check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-234475629References: Upstream kernel
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2186545: missing DM_TARGET_IMMUTABLE feature flag in verity_target in drivers/md/dm-verity-target.c

note.text: A flaw was found in hw. Incomplete cleanup of multi-core shared buffers for some Intel® Processors may allow an authenticated user to enable information disclosure via local access.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2090237: CVE-2022-21123 hw: cpu: incomplete clean-up of multi-core shared buffers (aka SBDR)

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Intel for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in hw. Incomplete cleanup of microarchitectural fill buffers on some Intel® Processors may allow an authenticated user to enable information disclosure via local access.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2090240: CVE-2022-21125 hw: cpu: incomplete clean-up of microarchitectural fill buffers (aka SBDS)

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Intel for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in hw. Incomplete cleanup in specific special register write operations for some Intel® Processors may allow an authenticated user to enable information disclosure via local access.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2090241: CVE-2022-21166 hw: cpu: incomplete clean-up in specific special register write operations (aka DRPW)

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Intel for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in the kernel/debug/debug_core.c in the Linux kernel in lockdown mode. This flaw allows an attacker with local access to trigger the debugger, bypass lockdown and write anonymously.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2084183: CVE-2022-21499 kernel: possible to use the debugger to write zero into a location of choice

note.text: A flaw was found in hw. Mis-trained branch predictions for return instructions may allow arbitrary speculative code execution under certain microarchitecture-dependent conditions.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2090226: CVE-2022-23816 CVE-2022-29900 hw: cpu: AMD: RetBleed Arbitrary Speculative Code Execution with Return Instructions

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Johannes Wikner (ETH Zürich) and Kaveh Razavi (ETH Zürich) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in hw. Aliases in the branch predictor may cause some AMD processors to predict the wrong branch type, potentially leading to information disclosure.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2103153: CVE-2022-23825 hw: cpu: AMD: Branch Type Confusion (non-retbleed)

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank AMD for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. When an application tries to open a directory (using the O_DIRECTORY flag) in a mounted NFS filesystem, a lookup operation is performed. If the NFS server returns a file as a result of the lookup, the NFS filesystem returns an uninitialized file descriptor instead of the expected ENOTDIR value. This flaw leads to the kernel's data leak into the userspace.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2051444: CVE-2022-24448 kernel: nfs_atomic_open() returns uninitialized data instead of ENOTDIR

note.text: A flaw was found in hw. In certain processors with Intel's Enhanced Indirect Branch Restricted Speculation (eIBRS) capabilities, soon after VM exit or IBPB command event, the linear address following the most recent near CALL instruction prior to a VM exit may be used as the Return Stack Buffer (RSB) prediction.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2115065: CVE-2022-26373 hw: cpu: Intel: Post-barrier Return Stack Buffer Predictions

note.text: A double-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel in the ems_usb_start_xmit function. This flaw allows an attacker to create a memory leak and corrupt the underlying data structure by calling free more than once.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2073064: CVE-2022-28390 kernel: double free in ems_usb_start_xmit in drivers/net/can/usb/ems_usb.c

note.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s net/sunrpc/xprt.c function in the Remote Procedure Call (SunRPC) protocol. This flaw allows a local attacker to crash the system, leading to a kernel information leak issue.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2074208: CVE-2022-28893 kernel: use after free in SUNRPC subsystem

note.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in u32_change in net/sched/cls_u32.c in the network subcomponent of the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local attacker to crash the system, cause a privilege escalation, and leak kernel information.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2088021: CVE-2022-29581 kernel: use-after-free due to improper update of reference count in net/sched/cls_u32.c

note.text: A flaw was found in hw. Mis-trained branch predictions for return instructions may allow arbitrary speculative code execution under certain microarchitecture-dependent conditions.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2090226: CVE-2022-23816 CVE-2022-29900 hw: cpu: AMD: RetBleed Arbitrary Speculative Code Execution with Return Instructions

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Johannes Wikner (ETH Zürich) and Kaveh Razavi (ETH Zürich) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A flaw was found in hw. Non-transparent sharing of branch predictor targets between contexts in some Intel(R) processors may potentially allow an authorized user to enable information disclosure via local access.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2103148: CVE-2022-29901 hw: cpu: Intel: RetBleed Arbitrary Speculative Code Execution with Return Instructions

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Johannes Wikner (ETH Zurich) and Kaveh Razavi (ETH Zurich) for reporting this issue.

note.text: A memory corruption flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s Netfilter subsystem in the way a local user uses the libnetfilter_queue when analyzing a corrupted network packet. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system or a remote user to crash the system when the libnetfilter_queue is used by a local user.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2115278: CVE-2022-36946 kernel: DoS in nfqnl_mangle in net/netfilter/nfnetlink_queue.c

note.text: A flaw was found in net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c in the Linux kernel. A denial of service can occur upon binding to an already bound chain.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2129152: CVE-2022-39190 kernel: nf_tables disallow binding to already bound chain

note.text: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel’s netfilter subsystem. The issue could occur due to an error in nf_tables_updtable while freeing a transaction object not placed on the list head. This flaw allows a local, unprivileged user to crash the system, resulting in a denial of service.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2173973: CVE-2023-1095 kernel: netfilter: NULL pointer dereference in nf_tables due to zeroed list head

note.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's udmabuf device driver, within a fault handler. This issue occurs due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in memory access past the end of an array. This may allow an attacker to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of the kernel.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2186862: improper validation of array index leading to local privilege escalation
